Faulk is considered week-to-week and is likely done for the rest of the regular season, per St. Louis Blues site editor/writer Lou Korac.

McTavish did not play in Thursday's (Apr. 18) game against Vegas.
Brazeau will be out week-to-week at this time and will not play Thursday (Apr. 4) in Carolina, Adam Pellerin of NESN.com reports.
Johansson (lower body) won't return for Sunday's opening game against the Florida Panthers, Chris Krenn of the Tampa Bay Lightning's official site reports.
Mintyukov did not play in Thursday's (Apr. 18) game against Vegas.
Barabanov is week-to-week and didn't travel with the team for Thursday's (Mar. 28) game versus Wild, per San Jose Sharks Beat Reporter Max Miller.

The Pittsburgh Penguins placed D Ryan Graves on the Injured Reserve.
The NHL and NHLPA announced that Bear will be out indefinitely while receiving care from the Player Assistance Program.
Jones is OUT with an upper-body injury, per Ducks.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F William Carrier on the Long-Term Injured Reserve.
The Blues announced that Sundqvist will undergo surgery on his right knee and be re-evaluated in six months.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed Acciari on Injured Reserve.
The Calgary Flames announced G Dan Vladar will receive season-ending hip surgery next week.
Coach Peter DeBoer said Hakanpaa might return for the playoffs.
Johnson did not play in Thursday's (Apr. 18) game versus Los Angeles.
Kuraly suffered a lower-body injury during Tuesday's (Mar. 12) loss to Montreal, is considered week-to-week, per Coby Maeir of 1st Ohio Battery on Wednesday.
Hayton is expected to be out longer than originally anticipated according to team reporter Patrick Brown.
Chinakhov is considered week-to-week, Jeff Svoboda of the Columbus Blue Jackets' official site reports.
The Colorado Avalanche placed O'Connor on injured reserve Monday (Mar. 25), per CapFriendly.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Kent Johnson on injured reserve.
The San Jose Sharks announced D Ty Emberson is not expected to play again this season after head coach David Quinn told reporters Monday (Mar. 25), per Max Miller of The Hockey News.

The New York Islanders announced D Scott Mayfield had successful season-ending surgery.
GM Kelly McCrimmon said that Stone will not return in the regular season.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Nathan Bastian on Injured Reserve.
The Ducks announced F McGinn underwent successful disc surgery last week and is expected to be out of action for four months.
The New York Rangers placed F Blake Wheeler on Injured Reserve.
Sharks GM Mike Grier said he expects Vanecek to be healthy to start the 2024-2025 season.
Couture said he will not return this season according to Curtis Pashekla of the Bay Area News Group.
Ristolainen underwent surgery on his ruptured triceps tendon. He is expected to be out three months and will make a full recovery.
The Tampa Bay Lightning placed D Mikhail Sergachev on the Injured Reserve.
Columbus Blue Jackets announced C Adam Fantilli is expected to be sidelined for eight weeks due to a calf laceration.

The Buffalo Sabres placed D Mattias Samuelsson on Injured Reserve.
Spurgeon will miss the remainder of the season due to injury according to the Minnesota Wild.

Laine entered the NHL/NHLPA Player Assistance Program and will be out indefinitely.
The Sharks announced that Benning's estimated time of recovery is approximately five months.
Boyd is expected to miss the rest of the season according to Craig Morgan of PHNX Sports.
Nieto underwent successful laparoscopic surgery on his right knee. Expected recovery is six to eight weeks.
The New Jersey Devils placed D Dougie Hamilton on long-term injured reserve, per James Nichols of New Jersey Hockey Now reports.
Lucic will be entering the NHL/NHLPA Player Assistance Program while he remains on indefinite leave.

Maple Leafs GM Brad Treliving said Klingberg will undergo surgery.
Chytil has been ruled out for the season by the New York Rangers.
